intro: Alyssum turkestanicum, commonly known as Turkistan Alyssum, is a flowering plant native to Central Asia. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes mustard and cabbages, and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm and produces white or pale yellow blooms. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, which help reduce water loss in arid environments. Alyssum turkestanicum is often found in rocky soils and is adapted to semi-arid climates.
